title: NK Lesson Citation Graph — K_avg Temporal Tracking at N=383
expect: K_avg ~1.15-1.25 due to ISO sprint adding 71 cross-references; uncited_pct to drop from 55.7% toward 50%; architecture remains TRANSITION_ZONE.
method: Scan all memory/lessons/L-*.md for L-NNN citations via regex; build directed graph; compute NK metrics with multi-edge and unique-pair counts; DFS cycle detection.
actual: K_avg=1.013 (multi-edge), K_avg_unique=0.841. 212/383 uncited (55.4%). 0 cycles. Total citations: 388.
diff: Expectation was K_avg ~1.15-1.25 from ISO sprint; actual K_avg barely moved (+0.010 from S318). ISO sprint annotated ISO-N tags, not L-NNN cross-references — the wrong citation type for K_avg. Uncited pct dropped only 0.3pp despite 71-lesson annotation effort.

interpretation.K_avg_trajectory: PLATEAU — three consecutive readings near 1.0 (S312: 1.028, S318: 1.003, S328: 1.013)
interpretation.hub_concentration: L-001 remains top hub (14 in-degree); top-10 hubs absorb 62/388 citations (16%)
interpretation.iso_sprint_finding: ISO annotations add ISO-N topic tags, not L-NNN lesson links — negligible K_avg impact
interpretation.structural_barrier: New lessons arrive without backward links; each new orphan dilutes K_avg
interpretation.swarm_implication: Data-parallel architecture wins; method-sequential not favored until K_avg >= 1.5

f75_connection: K_avg=1.013 < 1.5 threshold — data-parallel still wins; method decomposition not yet favored.
next: K_avg plateau near 1.0 is structural: ISO-tag sprints do not raise K_avg. Only explicit L-NNN cross-reference additions can move the metric. To cross 1.5 from 1.013 with N~400 requires ~196 new unique citation edges (from 322 to 518). Recommend: targeted citation-linking sprint (not ISO-tag sprint) or accept plateau as stable attractor.
